author: LStyer
title: Not a great model, but worth picking up for minifig and parts.
review:
I picked this polybag set up at Toys R Us last week.  I don't care at all for the model -- the "vehicle" side of the Ninjago theme leaves me cold and the bones-as-helicopter-blades design of this vehicle strikes me as particularly silly.

Pros

  • Good parts -- while I don't care for how the "leg-bone" pieces are used here, I'm happy to get ahold of four of them in an impulse set.
  • Again, while I don't like the finished model, it utilizes a few building techniques that I liked.  In particular I hadn't run into bone pieces connected to clips as they are here to form helicopter blades.  It immediately inspired me to try to create a prison door from bones.
  • The skeleton minifigure included is pretty cool.

Cons

  • I really don't like this model.  As I already mentioned, the bone helicopter blades strike me as ridiculous, and the model overall looks bulky for what is basically a variation on a jetpack.  I went ahead and built the model, and it wasn't a bad build experience, but I dinged playablity because even as a kid I'm pretty sure I would have hated the helicopter.
  • This is an "across-the-theme" complaint, but I don't dig the mix of feudal Japanese-inspired fantasy characters and architecture with modern-to-futuristic technology.
  • Another across-the-theme complaint -- I don't care for the skeleton's boots.  I can see myself dropping this complaint into every review I write of a Ninjago set that includes a skeleton.  It'll probably get old.

Even though I dislike the model, I'm glad I grabbed this for the pieces and the minifig.  In fact, I may pick up a couple more copies of this set for skeleton "army building" and to put together than bone prison I mentioned above.

author: JediAnakin
title: Flying Skeleton Action!
review:
I got this as part of a Newspaper promotion in May 2011.

Box/Instructions

Standard instructions and polybag is poor. 2/5

Parts

Parts are decent although not fantastic. 2/5

Minifigures

Frakjaw is the highlight of the set. Cheapest way to get hold of him! 3/5

The build

Build is poor. Building Experience is virtually nil, apart from a few bits which may be tricky for younger builders. 2/5

The completed model

Rather Poor, 3/5

Summary

Overall not a fantastic set. Although ability to use the parts for MOC's is undeniable!
